content: The Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 extends various assistance programs for veterans and their families, including monthly assistance allowance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee. The Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 extends assistance programs for veterans and their families, including monthly allowance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee. Amendments include changing the end date for assistance provision and technical corrections related to the United States Olympic Committee. Additionally, the Act specifies the applicability to Commonwealths and Territories of the United States Olympic Committee. The Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 extends assistance programs for veterans and their families, including monthly allowance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee. The Act also includes provisions for Guam National Olympic Committee, Comite Olimpico de Puerto Rico, and other entities representing the interests of the Northern Mariana Islands and the United States Virgin Islands. Additionally, there is a clerical amendment related to the table of sections in the Act. The curr_chunk is "521A. Assistance for United States Olympic Committee." Extension of various authorities related to healthcare and services for veterans is being extended to later dates in 2014, including copayments for hospital and nursing home care, recovery from third parties for care costs, homeless veterans reintegration programs, and counseling services for veterans at risk of homelessness. Extension of previously fully-funded authorities affecting homeless veterans includes comprehensive service programs with funding of $250,000,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $150,000,000 for fiscal year 2015 onwards. Financial assistance for supportive services for very low-income veteran families in permanent housing is extended for fiscal years 2013 and 2014. The grant program for homeless veterans with special needs is extended through 2014. Additionally, there is an extension of temporary eligibility for specially adapted housing assistance for certain veterans with disabilities causing difficulty with ambulating. The Secretary's approval limit for disabled veterans' assistance applications in fiscal year 2014 is set at 30. The authority to calculate net value of real property securing defaulted loans is extended to October 1, 2014. The pilot program for child care assistance for veterans is extended to a 3-year period. The authority for income verification purposes for certain veterans benefits is reauthorized, with specific expiration dates outlined for the Secretary of Health and Human Services and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 extends certain authorities until November 18, 2011. The Act will take effect on October 1, 2013, with specific provisions coming into effect on September 30, 2013. Any actions taken by the Department of Veterans Affairs during the specified period will be ratified if the Act is not enacted by September 30, 2013. Budgetary effects will be determined in compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.
